Neovim Core updates Updates of Neovim itself, which are available on Neovim nightly. Important: some updates might be missing from this week content. If you want to be sure to always keep up to date with what’s going on in Neovim Core, you are strongly advised to have a look to these places: @neovim on Twitter, which tweets the most recent news about the editor. :h news.txt will deliver you with the last news inside Neovim directly. Various PRs on GitHub. #22668 adds lua-loader. A builtin Lua module which byte-compiles and caches Lua files (speeds up load times). To enable, add vim.loader.enable() to your init.lua. Neovim Plugin Community updates Neovim is full of active plugins. This section is about the community and what is going on. Need help

entry.title: Find meta information about Github's services - #command-line
entry.summary: meta information api endpoint https://api.github.com/meta and you'll find most of the info you're looking for.

entry.title: Remove SSH keys from known host file by IP address - #command-line
entry.summary: a situation which caused the need to potentially remove Github's keys from your known_hosts file. ssh-keygen -R github.com ssh-keygen -R 140.82.114.4 ssh-keygen -R 140.82.113.3 github's meta information endpoint to find address ranges, but that's a problem for a more clever person.

entry.title: Elon wants GPT-5 stopped NOW… 5 reasons AI kinda sucks
Disable "Try it out" feature of Swagger UI - #ruby
entry.summary:
Swagger UI is a great way to view API documentation. It's even got a cool feature where you can excercise the api right from the documentation. Swagger UI documentation shows a configuration option called tryItOutEnabled. This sounds promising and the description even states: how to configure Swagger UI through rswag, we try: Rswag::Ui.configure do |c| c.config_object["tryItOutEnabled"] = false end supportedSubmitMethods and provide an empty array, we'll get something more usable. Rswag::Ui.configure do |c| c.config_object["supportedSubmitMethods"] = [] end
Now the button will completely disappear!

entry.title: Configure Swagger UI when using rubygem rswag - #ruby
entry.summary: rswag contains the library Swagger UI. This allows your generated documentation to be viewable from your webserver. Rswag::Ui.configure do |c| c.config_object["showExtensions"] = true end config_object. It is just a hash that you can set with keys that match available options found in Swagger UI's configuration docs

entry.summary:
Heroku console? heroku run "rails console -- --nomultiline"
Now it'll be disabled for that console session.

entry.title: Create a Date object for a specific day - #ruby
entry.summary:
Date#commercial is what you're looking for! It will create a Date object for you based on the year,week, and day that you give it. require 'date'
# Wednesday (3) of week 1 of year 2023 Date.commercial(2023, 1, 3) Date.commercial(Date.current.year, Date.current.cweek, 5) Rails TimeHelpers to travel to that specific date you need: next_friday = Date.commercial(Date.current.year, Date.current.cweek + 1, 5)
travel_to next_friday do # Friday specific code end
